image.altText: A blonde haired woman wearing glasses speaks

props.synopsis: The Greens say they will support Labor's proposed reforms targeting gun control, which are also included within the legislation, but not the hate speech reforms.

title.children: Greens join Coalition in rejecting government's 'divisive' hate speech laws

image.altText: John fenlon centre of a picture on holiday at the beach in roratonga.

props.synopsis: From February 25, dual citizens of the UK and Ireland will be required to enter the UK using a valid British or Irish passport, a change causing major headaches for dual citizens with imminent travel plans.

title.children: Passport rule change disrupts travel plans for thousands of Aussies

image.altText: A small boat moored at a marina.

props.synopsis: Living at Brisbane’s Kangaroo Point overlooking the river would typically come with a hefty price tag, but some residents have found an alternative.

title.children: Renters swapping apartments for boats for inner-city living at $500 a week

image.altText: Iran

props.synopsis: Israel joining with other countries in the Middle East to press Donald Trump not to launch a military strike against a weakened Iran is something that would have seemed incomprehensible even a couple of years ago.

title.children: A realignment is underway in the Middle East

image.altText: Two middle-aged men in suits stand awkwardly in a decorated room.

props.synopsis: The White House has released the names of leaders who will play a role in overseeing the next steps in Gaza, under the so-called "Board of Peace".

title.children: US taps Tony Blair, Marco Rubio and Jared Kushner for Gaza 'Board of Peace'

image.altText: Tim Walz is surrounded by  people at a public event in the US

props.synopsis: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz says the federal justice system is being weaponised to intimidate Donald Trump's perceived political enemies.

title.children: US Justice Department opens criminal investigation into Minnesota officials

image.altText: A besuited man speaks into a small microphone at a table.

props.synopsis: The US president insists America needs to acquire the territory of NATO partner Denmark for national security reasons.

title.children: Trump threatens tariffs on countries that oppose US Greenland takeover

image.altText: A pile of blister packs and boxes of pills lie on a counter.

props.synopsis: Just months after US President Donald Trump warned women about taking paracetamol during pregnancy, a new study finds there is no evidence linking the painkiller to autism in children.

title.children: Lancet rejects Trump's 'politicisation' of paracetamol use in pregnancy

image.altText: A truck is seen in front of a harden path, so signs of fire

props.synopsis: A grassfire tore through Natimuk in minutes, overwhelming warnings and emergency response. Experts say it signals a dangerous new phase of bushfires.

title.children: Security vision shows terrifying speed of a new kind of climate-driven fire

image.altText: Alpacas in a burnt out paddock in Harcourt

props.synopsis: Rita Soares says although she is grateful to still have a home, she would have sacrificed her house to save her llamas.

title.children: 'I wish the house had burnt': Shepherd grieves deaths of llamas in fire

image.altText: Woman with brown hair and man with white hair, a beard and hat stand in front of burnt house ruin.

props.synopsis: Several Victorian fires have been left out of mainstream media coverage, and one missed out on the Victorian government's initial support list, which has led to disappointment.

title.children: Burnt communities 'feel forgotten' in fire coverage and support

image.altText: A ferry on the River Derwent in Hobart, with moutains in the background, photographed from above.

props.synopsis: It is a world first — and years in the making — and when the massive electric ferry moved out into open water in Hobart for testing, there was a "big sigh of relief".

title.children: 'Relief' as world's biggest electric ferry starts sea trials

image.altText: A glass ball is illuminated by golden sunlight.

props.synopsis: Geraldton's Horizon Ball sculpture is drawing huge crowds of tourists after the spot gained international attention on social media.

title.children: Crowds flock to beach sculpture to see the sun set upside down

image.altText: Ioannis (Giannis) Vidiniotis with a neck brace in hospital, smiling.

props.synopsis: A young Greek tourist is flooded with donations and support after a tragic accident at Perth's most iconic beach left him with life-changing injuries.

title.children: Sandbank warning after tourist suffers catastrophic injuries at Cottesloe Beach

image.altText: A cricket player in pink raises his bat and helmet in celebration of a century

props.synopsis: Steve Smith smashes 32 runs from a single over after denying Babar Azam the strike, leaving the star Pakistan recruit less than impressed.

title.children: Smith breaks BBL record and outduels Warner as Pakistan teammate fumes

image.altText: Lance Armstrong holds his chin

props.synopsis: Lance Armstrong had successfully doped for years. But when the evidence backed him into a corner he took control of the narrative and confessed live on Oprah's couch, martyring himself to cycling's EPO era.

title.children: Lance Armstong destroyed his legacy with five monosyllabic answers to Oprah

image.altText: A woman in a brown dress looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Darwin midwife Claire Marks, who has been placed under a number of conditions by Australia's medical regulator, will continue to run the Northern Territory government's new private practice midwifery service, it's been confirmed.

title.children: Midwife banned from working unsupervised handed $1.1m NT government contract

image.altText: Two children stand on a hill in front of a large refugee camp.

props.synopsis: The South-East Asian country's armed forces launched an offensive in 2017 that forced over 700,000 ethnic Rohingya from their homes into neighbouring Bangladesh.

title.children: Myanmar denies 'genocidal intent' against Rohingya people

image.altText: An older woman in an orange jumper and red beanie, with long brown hair and glasses, holding a book and speaking.

props.synopsis: After more than a century of silence, the Bunurong language is being brought back to life by elders, linguists and community.

title.children: New dictionary aims to 'awaken' language not spoken fluently for 100 years

image.altText: dark clouds hover kurnell in sydney

props.synopsis: January is the middle of Australia's severe weather season and a multitude of hazards are emerging across the country this weekend.

title.children: Rain and cyclone threat in weekend of weather hazards across Australia

image.altText: A portrait of Craig Silvey, 43, with short brown hair and stubble, smiling brightly with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: A prominent parenting expert says serious allegations made against one of Australia’s most renowned authors should spark difficult but important conversations in households across the country.

title.children: How to talk to your children about the allegations against author Craig Silvey

image.altText: A computer generated image of a multi-storey glass building on the corner of two roads

props.synopsis: As the wrecking ball looms, a community battle is brewing over whether historic flour mill walls need to fall to make way for development.

title.children: Developer's bid to demolish 140-year-old flour mill walls faces backlash

image.altText: A black and white photograph of crowds watching people skate at a skate park.

props.synopsis: Australia is home to one of the world's oldest surviving skate parks, which is as much a product of surfing culture as it is a time capsule of skating history.

title.children: Fifty years ago, Australia's first skate park was built in WA

image.altText: Jakara Anthony performs a flip during a training run

props.synopsis: Jakara Anthony has claimed her 26th moguls title to become Australia's most successful World Cup skier in an imposing sign ahead of next month's Olympics.

title.children: Olympic champion Jakara Anthony claims record-breaking win

image.altText: Man in a white cap and white shirt holds tennis racquet on the court while yelling excitedly.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's first-round opponent, Matteo Berrettini, faces a race against time to be fit for the start of the Australian Open.

title.children: Berrettini fighting illness ahead of Australian Open clash with de Minaur

image.altText: A sail boat on the water with the brand Bonds emblazoned all over it

props.synopsis: Team Australia has suffered an early injury setback in the lead-up to the opening race of the Sail Grand Prix season, which Fremantle is hosting for the first time this weekend.

title.children: 'No clear favourite' in SailGP as Team Australia suffers injury setback

image.altText: Campbell Harrison and boyfriend Justin Maire share a kiss in the climbing gym

props.synopsis: Campbell Harrison was homophobically trolled in the lead-up to the Paris Olympics. It strengthened his conviction about the importance of visible queer role models in sport.

title.children: Why this Olympian is proud to be a gay role model despite trolling

image.altText: A birds eye view of the eastern lake where you can see how much the water has receded, leaving behind a dry cracked lakebed

props.synopsis: Imperial Lakes Nature Park may soon dry out for the first time in over a century, creating an environmental crisis for the region and the hundreds of native animals that call the lakes home.

title.children: Outback lake home to hundreds of turtles set to run dry in 130-year first

image.altText: Nelson Asofa-Solomona stands over a fallen Jeremy Latimore in the boxing ring.

props.synopsis: Nelson Asofa-Solomona calls out his former rugby league competitors after making a successful transition to the fight game by knocking out Jeremy Latimore.

title.children: Asofa-Solomona plans to 'clean up the whole NRL division' after boxing debut

image.altText: A boxer looks perplexed in a ring with people around him

props.synopsis: Nikita Tszyu and Michael Zerafa hotly anticipated fight is abandoned after the second round as the crowd vents its frustration at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre.

title.children: Tszyu accuses 'cowardly' Zefara of quitting after grudge match called off

image.altText: Nicholas Taylor wears a black t-shirt and sits front-on to the camera.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Taylor told a court last year that he was abused as a student at a Hobart Catholic school in the 1970s and 1980s. One of his alleged abusers was former Test cricket umpire Stephen Randell.

title.children: 'It played enough on my life': Victim-survivor reveals identity to help others

image.altText: A man wearing a navy suit stands in front of media microphones speaking and gesticulating.

props.synopsis: The dramatic cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week spiralled the news cycle out of Premier Peter Malinauskas's control. But will the saga actually mean anything come the March state election?

title.children: Writers' Week grabbed headlines, but were voters on the same page?

image.altText: A pipe bomb outside on the ground

props.synopsis: The discovery of 15 explosive devices along footpaths near a Canberra lake shocked residents this week, raising questions about how the devices came to be there and who could be responsible.

title.children: What we know about the pipe bombs found in Canberra this week

image.altText: Sarah Blizzard gives a thumbs up to the camera with a crowd of people behind her.

props.synopsis: With hopes of reaching the Winter Olympics fading due to a dodgy bobsleigh, the Dutch team was running out of answers until Australian Sarah Blizzard rode to the rescue and helped the Netherlands' sliders achieve their dreams.

title.children: Heartwarming act of Aussie sportsmanship offers Olympic lifeline

image.altText: an aerial image of a water race course

props.synopsis: A water ski racing group has planned an alleged unsanctioned racing event in South Australia, which the state's Department for Infrastructure and Transport says it has not approved. It comes as the peak body for the sport has nationally suspended racing due to safety concerns.

title.children: Unauthorised ski racing event threatens 'death of the sport'
